title: Gnome
data:
- *This page is about the player [species](/Species "Species"). For the monster, see [Gnome (monster)](/Gnome_\(monster\) "Gnome (monster)").*

***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

**Gnomes** were an underground-dwelling race of creatures, related to the dwarves but even more closely in touch with the earth. They were a small race, and aptitude-wise, shared many characteristics with [halflings](/Halfling "Halfling"). However, they advanced slightly more slowly in [experience](/Experience "Experience") levels, and were somewhat more competent casters. In particular, they could be excellent [Earth mages](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic"), having a superlative aptitude for that skill and good aptitude for [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations"), though they were somewhat held back by their poor [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") aptitude. They had an innate [magic mapping](/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping") ability.

## Contents

- [1 Preferred Classes](#Preferred_Classes)
- [2 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [3 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [4 History](#History)

## Preferred Classes

Gnomes were among the least versatile races in the game, usually becoming [Chaos Knights](/Chaos_Knight "Chaos Knight"), [Crusaders](/Crusader "Crusader"), [Enchanters](/Enchanter "Enchanter"), [Earth Elementalists](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist"), [Stalkers](/Stalker "Stalker"), and [Assassins](/Assassin "Assassin").

## Level Bonuses

- -1 [HP](/HP "HP") every level until character level 13.
- -1 [HP](/HP "HP") every 3rd level.
- Average [MP](/MP "MP").
- +1 [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") or [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") every 4th level.

## Skill aptitudes

The lower the value, the better the aptitude.

|               [Skill](/Skill "Skill")              | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |              [Skill](/Skill "Skill")              | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") | [Skill](/Skill "Skill")                            | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |
| :------------------------------------------------: | :------------------------------: | :-----------------------------------------------: | -------------------------------: | -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------: |
|                    ***Attack***                    |                                  |                ***Miscellaneous***                |                                  | ***Magic***                                        |                                  |
|          [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting")          |                100               |             [Armour](/Armour "Armour")            |                              150 | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")       |                              156 |
|          [Short Blades](/Weapon "Weapon")          |                75                |           [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")           |                               70 | [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")       |                              100 |
|           [Long Blades](/Weapon "Weapon")          |                100               |           [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth")           |                               70 | [Enchantments](/Enchantments "Enchantments")       |                              100 |
|              [Axes](/Weapon "Weapon")              |                100               |          [Stabbing](/Stabbing "Stabbing")         |                               80 | [Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings")             |                              110 |
|         [Maces & Flails](/Weapon "Weapon")         |                130               |           [Shields](/Shields "Shields")           |                              120 | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")             |                              130 |
|            [Polearms](/Weapon "Weapon")            |                140               | [Traps & Doors](/Traps_%26_Doors "Traps & Doors") |                               60 | [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") |                              130 |
|      [Staves](/Magical_staff "Magical staff")      |                130               |                                                   |                                  | [Transmutation](/Transmutation "Transmutation")    |                              120 |
| [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat") |                110               |     [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations")     |                               90 | [Divinations](/Divinations "Divinations")          |                              120 |
|                                                    |                                  |       [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations")      |                               45 |                                                    |                                  |
|          [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")          |                100               |                                                   |                                  | [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")             |                              100 |
|             [Slings](/Weapon "Weapon")             |                80                |                                                   |                                  | [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic")                |                              100 |
|              [Bows](/Weapon "Weapon")              |                100               |                                                   |                                  | [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")                |                              170 |
|            [Crossbows](/Weapon "Weapon")           |                90                |                                                   |                                  | [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")          |                               60 |
|              [Darts](/Weapon "Weapon")             |                60                |       [Experience](/Experience "Experience")      |                              110 | [Poison Magic](/Poison_Magic "Poison Magic")       |                              130 |

## History

Gnomes were removed in [0.5](/0.5 "0.5"). [Deep Dwarves](/Deep_Dwarves "Deep Dwarves"), introduced in [0.6](/0.6 "0.6"), co-opted a few of the features of gnomes, notably the aptitudes for [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations") and [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic"), and the ability to sense their surroundings.

Interestingly, they also bear some resemblance to [Gargoyles](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle"): strong defense but low HP, and great earth casters but also competent physical fighters. It is not known whether or not this was intentional.
html:
Gnome

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
This page is about the player species. For the monster, see Gnome (monster).
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

Gnomes were an underground-dwelling race of creatures, related to the dwarves but even more closely in touch with the earth. They were a small race, and aptitude-wise, shared many characteristics with halflings. However, they advanced slightly more slowly in experience levels, and were somewhat more competent casters. In particular, they could be excellent Earth mages, having a superlative aptitude for that skill and good aptitude for Conjurations, though they were somewhat held back by their poor Spellcasting aptitude. They had an innate magic mapping ability.

Contents

  • 1 Preferred Classes
  • 2 Level Bonuses
  • 3 Skill aptitudes
  • 4 History

Preferred Classes

Gnomes were among the least versatile races in the game, usually becoming Chaos Knights, Crusaders, Enchanters, Earth Elementalists, Stalkers, and Assassins.

Level Bonuses

  • -1 HP every level until character level 13.
  • -1 HP every 3rd level.
  • Average MP.
  • +1 dexterity or intelligence every 4th level.

Skill aptitudes

The lower the value, the better the aptitude.

Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude
Attack Miscellaneous Magic
Fighting 100 Armour 150 Spellcasting 156
Short Blades 75 Dodging 70 Conjurations 100
Long Blades 100 Stealth 70 Enchantments 100
Axes 100 Stabbing 80 Summonings 110
Maces & Flails 130 Shields 120 Necromancy 130
Polearms 140 Traps & Doors 60 Translocations 130
Staves 130 Transmutation 120
Unarmed Combat 110 Invocations 90 Divinations 120
Evocations 45
Throwing 100 Fire Magic 100
Slings 80 Ice Magic 100
Bows 100 Air Magic 170
Crossbows 90 Earth Magic 60
Darts 60 Experience 110 Poison Magic 130

History

Gnomes were removed in 0.5. Deep Dwarves, introduced in 0.6, co-opted a few of the features of gnomes, notably the aptitudes for Evocations and Earth Magic, and the ability to sense their surroundings.

Interestingly, they also bear some resemblance to Gargoyles: strong defense but low HP, and great earth casters but also competent physical fighters. It is not known whether or not this was intentional.

Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Gnome&oldid=25271"

{{Obsolete}}

'''Gnomes''' were an underground-dwelling race of creatures, related to the dwarves but even more closely in touch with the earth.  They were a small race, and aptitude-wise, shared many characteristics with [[halfling]]s.  However, they advanced slightly more slowly in [[experience]] levels, and were somewhat more competent casters.  In particular, they could be excellent [[Earth Magic|Earth mages]], having a superlative aptitude for that skill and good aptitude for [[Conjurations]], though they were somewhat held back by their poor [[Spellcasting]] aptitude.  They had an innate [[magic mapping]] ability.

==Preferred Classes==
Gnomes were among the least versatile races in the game, usually becoming [[Chaos Knight]]s, [[Crusader]]s, [[Enchanter]]s, [[Earth Elementalist]]s, [[Stalker]]s, and [[Assassin]]s.

==Level Bonuses==
*-1 [[HP]] every level until character level 13.
*-1 [[HP]] every 3rd level.
*Average [[MP]].
*+1 [[dexterity]] or [[intelligence]] every 4th level.

==History==

Gnomes were removed in [[0.5]].  [[Deep Dwarves]], introduced in [[0.6]], co-opted a few of the features of gnomes, notably the aptitudes for [[Evocations]] and [[Earth Magic]], and the ability to sense their surroundings.

Interestingly, they also bear some resemblance to [[Gargoyle]]s: strong defense but low HP, and great earth casters but also competent physical fighters.  It is not known whether or not this was intentional.
